question:
How to get rid of the black bars on the top or sides of the movie?

Choices:
A: Change the screen settings on your TV or video player to change the color to fit the screen.
B: Change the screen settings on your TV or video player to stretch the picture to fit the screen.
steps: Black bars appear when a movie or video has a different aspect ratio than the screen on which it is being displayed.
The black bars are used to maintain the original aspect ratio of the movie, ensuring that the picture isn't distorted.
If you want to get rid of these black bars, you can change the screen settings to adjust the aspect ratio of the display.
Specifically, changing the screen settings to stretch the picture to fit the screen will fill the entire screen with the video, removing the black bars.
Option A suggests changing the color to fit the screen, which will not remove the black bars but merely change their appearance.
Therefore, the correct way to get rid of the black bars is to select option B: Change the screen settings on your TV or video player to stretch the picture to fit the screen.
